Full path to file:

p.b: Ceph deployments must use dedicated RADOS gateway cluster

section.p: When using a deployment that utilizes Ceph, such as the example configuration entry-scale-kvm-ceph, it's important to use a dedicated cluster for the RADOS gateway, as described in . If you attempt to deploy the Ceph RADOS gateway service on the controller node cluster, you will run into issues as it cannot co-exist with the Horizon dashboard service.

section.title: Helion Development Platform
section.p:
Helion Development Platform (HDP) 2.0 or earlier versions are not supported on If you have existing HDP 2.0 deployment on 2.X platform, consider the following before upgrading to .
Helion Stackato 3.6.2 is the recommended and supported PaaS product on .
Helion Database Service and Messaging Service are not included and not supported on .
Please see: Upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack to Version 3.0 for more information.

section.title: MySQL is sensitive to logrotate
section.p: If a cluster is broken and MySQL attempts a logrotate, it could end up creating a secondary log file, such as error.log.1 or mysql-slow.log.1. In this state, the files will continue to grow and will not be rotated. To fix the issue, a mysql restart must be run on all nodes where MySQL is running.

section.title: RabbitMQ stalls the cluster in large scale
section.p: The RabbitMQ management plugin will cause performance issues with large scale installations. The work around is to disable the plugin with the following command: sudo rabbitmq-plugins disable rabbitmq_management This should be done on all controllers running RabbitMQ.

section.title: NIC-Mapping
section.p: This is only relevant if you are using the NIC mapping feature in your input model, you are running hLinux and have multi-port cards.
During internal testing it has been identified that the udev rules for multi-port NIC cards generated by earlier versions of could prevent hLinux 4.4 from booting.
For reference these rules are defined in this file: /etc/udev/rules.d/90-helion-nic-mapping.rules.

During the upgrade this file will be re-generated with updated contents. The new udev file fixes the issue that could prevent hLinux 4.4 from booting while performing the required mapping of devices to device-names.

section.title: Dashboard (Horizon)

p.b: When creating a Swift container, the progress bar never ends

section.p: There is a bug in the dashboard when you create a new Swift object storage container where the progress bar never ends even after the container has been successfully created. There is no workaround, it can just be ignored.

p.b: Swift container file uploads initiated via the dashboard may stall out and fail

section.p: Due to the way the Horizon dashboard is architected, some file uploads to Swift containers may stall out and fail. You will mostly see this in large files but it can happen with smaller files depending on the size of root disk partition on your controller nodes.

The way the Horizon dashboard transfers files is that they stage the files in a temporary directory before sending the files to Swift. If the root disk partition is less than the size of the file you are attempting to upload, it will run out of disk space and cause an error.

There is an architectural fix being worked in upstream OpenStack to alleviate this issue but right now the workaround is to either increase the disk space for your root disk partition or you can use the Swift CLI or the API to upload files, which does not run into this issue. Keep in mind that Swift still has the 5GB file limitation in general before chunking the file is necessary.

section.title: Compute (Nova)

p.b: Change in policy.json File

section.p: The policy.json file for the Nova service has been changed, although the location of the file remains the same:
Old name/location: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/nova/policy.json
New name/location: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/nova/policy.json.j2
If you have made changes to this file in your environment, you should recreate these changes in the new file.

p.b: Live Migration between KVM and RHEL Compute Hosts Isn't Supported

section.p: If you are using both Linux for HPE Helion (KVM) and RHEL compute hosts, you cannot live migrate instances between them. Instances on KVM hosts can only be live migrated to other KVM hosts and the same for RHEL hosts. For more details about live migration, see .

p.b: Two upstream limitations regarding live migration abortion parameters that exist

section.p: There are two upstream limitations when configuring the live-migration abortion parameters that also exist in our product:

ol.li: The live_migration_downtime, live_migration_downtime_steps and live_migration_downtime_delay default values are not honored. See for more details. If you want to set up values different than the minimum ones then you need to do it explicitly.

Live-migration monitoring is not working properly. The consequence is that the live_migration_completion_timeout parameter has no effect and is overridden by live_migration_progress_timeout. See for more details.

p.b: Enabling migrate or resize

section.p: If you want to enable migrate or resize in Nova you must do so after installing or upgrading to and before any subsequent configuration change which requires running the configuration processor. For additional information and workaround, see:

section.title: Compute (ESX)

p.b: Unable to Create Instance Snapshot when Instance is Active

section.p: There is a known issue with VMWare vCenter where if you have a compute instance in Active state you will receive the error below when attempting to take a snapshot of it:
section.codeblock: An error occurred while saving the snapshot: Failed to quiesce the virtual machine
section.p: The workaround for this issue is to stop the instance prior to taking the snapshot. For details on the workaround, see .

p.b: Parallel activations and/or deactivations are not allowed for ESX Compute

section.p: You should not attempt parallel activations/deactivations for ESX computes using Eon command-line interface (CLI) . Eon CLI used for activate and deactivate are eon resource-activate and eon resource-deactivate, respectively.

You should check if cluster resource has changed to the desired states before attempting activation or deactivation of ESX cluster. The desired states are imported, activated and provisioned. The ESX cluster compute states can be obtained using eon resource-list CLI.

p.b: ESX Attach Interface

section.p: In an ESX cloud environment Attach Interface to the instances is not supported.

section.title: Use of InfluxDB version 9.5.1 Not Recommended
section.p: Although Helion OpenStack ships with InfluxDB version 9.5.1, it is not recommended to be used in a HOS 3.0 environment. InfluxDB will randomly start to fail silently without any indication to the user. This can happen at any time. The only sign of failure is InfluxDB will start timing out connections to it. The only way to find that the problem is occurring is looking at the influxdb logs. The only way to fix it is to either stop the load from pushing through it or restart InfluxDB.

section.title: Block Storage (Cinder)

p.b: Volume backups when you have multiple volume types

section.p: If you have more than one volume type, then before you restore a volume from backup you should create a new volume of the correct type and size. Then restore the backup into the new volume. This is particularly relevant if the backed-up volume is encrypted.

Although supports encrypted Block Storage volumes, the following limitations apply:
Creating encrypted volumes from an image is not supported.
Creating encrypted volumes when using a Ceph backend is not supported. This bug can be seen here.
Attaches and detaches of encrypted volumes are not supported with non-multipath Fiber Channel backends.

Under the following conditions the allow_availability_zone_fallback flag must be set to True in cinder.conf in order to boot Nova instances:
The instance boot source is an image
A new volume is being created to persist the instance data
The availability zone specified is different to the Cinder availability zone

If a volume is created from a cached image or from a volume snapshot, and a size is specified that is different than the cached image or snapshot size, the volume will not be created at the requested size. Cinder will report that the volume size is the size requested; however the volume on the back-end will only be the size of the cached image or snapshot. This is a known limitation in Cinder and applies to most back-ends, including 3Par and StoreVirtual.

The Attach volume operation will fail frequently after scaling to 2200 instances with volume attached, if it is triggered with concurrency 25. In order to avoid this, the rpc_timeout value must be increased to 180. Increasing the value merely postpones the error and is only meant to be a temporary solution.
If you have enabled CHAP authentication on a 3PAR backend then you will not be able to backup an attached volume that is provisioned on that backend.
It is not possible to backup an attached volume that was provisioned on VSA.
Consistency groups are not supported with VSA backends.
Cinder volumes on backends connected using native FCoE are not supported.

In some configurations where iSCSI targets are configured / enabled an entry similar to the following may appear frequently in the syslog: systemd-sysv-generator[<pid>]: Ignoring creation of an alias umountiscsi.service for itself This doesn't indicate a problem and is a result of systemd being overly verbose for informational messages.

Cinder volume creation with VMDK as backend will take approximately 30 minutes with 200 ESXi hosts in the environment. In a smaller environment, the time to create a volume will be approximately 10 minutes.

p.b: Multipath cannot be enabled when using VSA

section.p: If a compute node is configured to use multipath to attach volumes, that is, if it has the configuration variable iscsi_use_multipath set to true in the libvirt section of the nova config file, then it will not be possible to attach a VSA volume to a nova instance hosted on that compute node.

section.title: glance image-show for a snapshot stored in CEPH fails
section.p: Glance has been configured to use CEPH as the store for images. An instance is created and then snapshotted and the resulting snapshot is seen in CEPH as expected. However, when using the glance image-show command against the snapshot it will fail. You can view the snapshot using the openstack image showcommand instead.

section.title: Ceph health status
section.p: If Ceph health status displays WARN with too few pgs, you can increase the pg_num and pgp_num to resolve the issue.
Example: health HEALTH_WARN pool .rgw has too few pgs
Increase the pg_num and pgp_num count by running: ceph osd pool get <pool-name> pg_num
More information on pg_num and pgp_num can be found here:

section.title: Identity (Keystone)
section.p: There will be performance degradation to a user's account in your cloud environment if the number of roles assigned to that user goes above ~1000. You are advised to use the user account functionality in an efficient way so that this does not become an issue. This was reported in upstream OpenStack here.

p.b: Rados Gateway error in fetching token revocation list from Keystone

section.p: Fetching the list of revoked tokens from OpenStack Keystone is only supported for PKI tokens. does not support using PKI tokens (disables it by default) due to security concerns. The below error encountered (periodically) in Rados Gateway logs can be safely ignored and does not require any corrective action. ERROR: keystone revocation processing returned error r=-22

p.b: Brocade backends - Existing volume detach fails after modifying the zoning_mode=fabric from none.

section.p: Due to this bug, you cannot change the zoning_mode post-installation. You must use either a preconfigured zone or auto_zoning with Brocade.

section.title: Image Service (Glance)

p.b: Image sharing between projects is disabled for non-admin users

section.p: By default in we have altered the Glance policies to only allow image sharing by the admin user. The policies are set as follows:
section.codeblock: "add_member": "role:admin or role:glance_admin", "delete_member": "role:admin or role:glance_admin", "get_member": "role:admin or role:glance_admin", "get_members": "role:admin or role:glance_admin", "modify_member": "role:admin or role:glance_admin",
section.p: This is due to the security issue documented here.

section.title: Bare Metal (Ironic)
section.p: Multipath in not supported for the boot device. In case multiple paths exist use zoning so that only one path is available.
If there are multiple NICs that are connected to the Management network, and the first NIC does not have access, then deployment will fail. Ensure that the first NICâ€™s connection is UP.

section.title: Network (Neutron)
section.p: VM's may not get an IP address from the DHCP server when creating VMs in large scale. This may occur when booting a large number of VMs at the same time when all of the networking may not be up in time before the DHCP retries timeout. If this occurs, reboot the VM.

p.b: Support for IPv6 on tenant networks (listed as non-core)

section.p: Enabling IPv6 for tenant networks is a manual step as no Helion lifecycle management support is provided.
There is no support for IPv6 on cloud infrastructure networks (i.e., MANAGEMENT)

section.title: RBAC (Neutron)
section.p: Port creation on a shared network fails if --fixed-ip is specified in the neutron port-create command. This is reported in https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1543756.

section.title: VPN Service(Neutron)
section.p: In 2.X and the Metering agent cannot be used in conjunction with VPNaaS.

ul.li: The Load Balancer Octavia driver requires KVM based compute nodes but also supports mixed environments. The Octavia driver currently provides limited load balancer failover functionality that may have a unpredictable failover time. Other load balancer solutions should be considered If predictable and fast (less than 10 seconds) load balancer failover timing is required.
Using a Floating IP with Octavia will not work in DVR enabled networks. The recommendation is to create a router with DVR switched off when using a Floating IP.

section.title: Monitoring (Monasca)
section.p: Whenever a system that is part of the Monasca cluster is rebooted, there is a possibility that the Monasca Threshold Engine will fail to recover. The symptom will be Alarms in the Ops Console that stay red or grey even though they should be green. The Monasca Threshold Engine is what determines the states of the alarms based on the measurements being received from the Monasca agents.

The workaround is to restart the Monasca Threshold Engine. Use the following commands to stop and start the Monasca Threshold Engine: ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-stop.yml --tags thresh ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-start.yml --tags thresh

p.b: Monasca api logs showing "OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space"

section.p: If the Monasca API fails with OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space errors it is recommended that you restart the monasca-api.

section.title: SOSReport error during data collection
section.p: In rare instances when issuing command ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts sosreport-run.yml from the lifecycle manager, one of the nodes may list an error about not being able to collect data. If this issue occurs, ssh to the node that is experiencing the problem. Once on the node, attempt to run sudo sosreport -v. If sosreport fails to complete gathering, record what is shown on the screen. A reboot of the affected node will clear the error condition. The exact messages last shown on screen on local run was: Running 64/87: openvswitch... [plugin:openvswitch] unpacked command tuple: ('ovs-dpctl -s show', 'None', 'None', 300, 'None') *[plugin:openvswitch] collecting output of 'ovs-dpctl -s show' *

section.title: Change to Monasca Monitoring Roles in Keystone
section.p: In Helion OpenStack version 2.x, the keystone role for submitting cross-tenant metrics was called 'monasca-agent'. In HOS 3.0, the keystone role for submitting cross-tenant metrics is now called 'monitoring-delegate'. Any user who submits cross-tenant metrics without the 'monitoring-delegate' role will now receive a '403 Forbidden' http response.

section.title: Cannot use wildcards in multipath blacklist on RHEL Boot from SAN nodes
section.p: You will need to change your input model if your system includes RHEL nodes that are configured to boot from a multipath device (boot from SAN). Otherwise those nodes will not be able to access their boot devices when you reboot them. Most of the example models supplied with HOS 3.0 include a blacklist with wildcards like this:

p.b: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/multipath/multipath_settings.yml

section.p: These do not work properly on RHEL 7.2, so you will need to change it to a specific list of devices. In particular, you need to ensure that the device you are booting from is not represented in the blacklist stanza. For example, you could use the following to blacklist all volumes on the local HP SmartArray:

p.b: Change to a specific list of device types:

section.p: The exact list that you need will vary depending on the hardware that is in use. However, this example is appropriate for most HP servers that use SmartArray technology for their local disks, assuming you don't want multipath configured on the local devices which is typically the case.
section.note: If you have a mix of RHEL and HPE Linux nodes in your compute pool, you need to be aware that any configuration you use for multipath_blacklist is global and will also apply to the HPE Linux nodes.

section.title: Cannot remove disks from disk model post deployment.
section.p: You must ensure your device model aligns with your node configuration at all times. If you remove a device from a server, it may lead to renaming of devices on your system either immediately, or following a reboot or rescan, and you may invalidate your device model. Follow the documented procedures for replacement of broken disk drives so that the device model remains accurate.

section.title: Agent monitoring feature of networking-vsphere needs to be disabled during installation or upgrade.
section.p: You should disable Agent monitoring feature of networking-vsphere if you have modified the ml2_conf.ini.j2 file in the input model folder. If the Agent monitoring is not disabled, this feature will generate false positives and place hosts into maintenance mode.

To disable the Agent monitoring feature, set the configuration parameter enable_ovsvapp_monitor to False in the [OVSVAPP] section of the ml2_conf.ini.j2 file. Once the parameter has been set, it is safe to proceed with installation or upgrade.
Example: ... [OVSVAPP] enable_ovsvapp_monitor = False

section.title: Vertica upgrade failure
section.p: On rare occasion Vertica hangs on start up during upgrade. This is due to temporary network drops. To resolve the issue, exit out of the hanging upgrade and then run monasca-start.yml --tags vertica. You can then continue by rerunning the upgrade.

section.title: Rapidly Creating VMs
section.p: If creating large numbers of VMs in a synchronous manner (greater than 3 VMs per minute), VM creation failure of up to 10% may be experienced. To work around this behavior, lower the VM creation rate until consistent success is achieved.

section.title: Fact cache entry isn't valid
section.p:
If at the very start of an Ansible run you see a message like the following:
Fact cache entry for host COMPUTE-0002 isn't valid, deleting and failing Fact cache entry for host COMPUTE-0001 isn't valid, deleting and failing ERROR: The JSON cache files COMPUTE-0002, COMPUTE-0001 were corrupt, or did not otherwise contain valid JSON data. They have been removed, so you can re-run your command now.
Then please just re-run your Ansible command.

section.title: Instance fail to spawn with type <tuple error> in ESXi environment.
section.p: The percentage of the failure is approximately 1.4% out of 8000 instance spawned. 4.0 will have a fix for this issue.

section.title: Remote Catalog (Sherpa)
section.p: The Sherpa Service is no longer provided with .

section.title: Best Practices for Backup and Restore (Freezer)
section.p: You should not add or modify the files in the following standard control-plane directories. These directories are automatically backed up and modifying their contents will cause control-plane restore jobs to fail.

section.title: VSA server creation sometimes fails
section.p: Create VSA appliance playbook sometimes fails to complete on one or more VSA servers. If this happens and the installation fails then re-run the playbook. For example, if the installation failed when running the site.yml playbook, re-run the site.yml playbook.

section.title: Security groups in an ESX Cloud
section.p: You cannot have more than 400 virtual machines per security group in an ESX cloud.

section.title: After running upgrade, keystone.log warns that policy.json cannot be found
section.p: Fleeting errors such as this may occur during live upgrades. During a live upgrade, services are not prevented from contacting each other. Thus you may see transient errors. Such errors are only a concern if the logs show continued failure after the upgrade completes.
